intro: Capsella divaricata, commonly known as the common mouse-ear or mouse-ear cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a small annual herb that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the upper leaves are narrower and more elongated. Its flowers are small, white, and arranged in clusters, often appearing in late spring to early summer. Capsella divaricata is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
